title: [bug] the Monitor class not correctly initialize

labels.name: status: needs triage
labels.description: This issue needs to triage, applied to new issues

body:
### Describe the bug

```typescript
const monitor = await currentMonitor()
if (monitor) {
  const { size, scaleFactor } = monitor
  size.toLogical(scaleFactor); // <--- [Error] toLogical does not exist on size
}
```

I have searched and read #2599 and #2621, and I think if we return a `Monitor` instance [here](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri/blob/43348652662fad65914959829073e6ba08cc412d/tooling/api/src/window.ts#L1221):
```typescript
/**
 * Returns the monitor on which the window currently resides.
 * Returns `null` if current monitor can't be detected.
 */
async function currentMonitor(): Promise<Monitor | null> {
  return invokeTauriCommand({
    __tauriModule: 'Window',
    message: {
      cmd: 'manage',
      data: {
        cmd: {
          type: 'currentMonitor'
        }
      }
    }
  })
} // .then(res => new Monitor( ... ))
```
this problem might be solved.
